intro: Calyptrosicyos grevei, commonly known as the African burr legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves and produces distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Calyptrosicyos grevei plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
